title: 148862776.how Did You Do That
excerpt: Most of the time, the answer to that question in fairly straightforward. It’s a simple as following a recipe or a checklist.

children.text: Most of the time, the answer to that question in fairly straightforward. It’s a simple as following a recipe or a checklist.
But what about when the doing part isn’t easy to explain? When the answer to the question is, ‘I don’t know how to tell you how.”
Doing a triple axel. Writing excellent copy. Recognizing a pattern before anyone else has.
If you can do something so good that you can’t explain how you did it, it might be a good sign that you’re onto something remarkable.
